resources.string: Workout and get fit at home
Let\'s do a workout\n and live healthy\n with us
What do You Want to Train?

Step 1: Start in the push-up position with your arms completely straight and directly beneath your shoulders.

 Step 2: Your body should form a straight line from your shoulders to your ankles.

 Step 3: Squeeze your abs, lift one foot off the floor and bring your knee up towards your chest while keeping your body in as straight of a line as possible.

 Step 4: Return to the starting position and repeat the movement with your opposite leg.

Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.

 Step 2: Lower your body by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, as if sitting down on an imaginary chair.

 Step 3: Keep your back straight and your chest up.

 Step 4: Push through your heels to return to the starting position.

Step 1: Start by standing with your feet together.

 Step 2: Take a step forward with one leg and lower your body until both knees are bent at 90-degree angles.

 Step 3: Push off the front foot to return to the starting position.

 Step 4: Repeat with the opposite leg.

Step 1: Begin in a push-up position with your arms extended and hands beneath your shoulders.

 Step 2: Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels, engaging your core muscles.

 Step 3: Hold this position for the desired duration, keeping your abs and glutes tight.

Step 1: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart.

 Step 2: Drop into a squat position and place your hands on the floor in front of you.

 Step 3: Kick your feet back into a push-up position.

 Step 4: Perform a push-up.

 Step 5: Jump your feet back to the squat position.

 Step 6: Explosively jump up into the air, reaching your arms overhead.

Step 1: Begin in a push-up position with your arms extended and hands beneath your shoulders.

 Step 2: Drive one knee toward your chest while keeping your hips down and your core engaged.

 Step 3: Quickly switch legs in a running motion, alternating knees.

Step 1: Start by standing with your feet together and arms at your sides.

 Step 2: Jump your feet out wide as you simultaneously raise your arms overhead.

 Step 3: Jump your feet back together and return your arms to your sides.

Step 1: Stand with your feet hip-width apart.

 Step 2: Lift your right knee towards your chest, aiming to get it as high as possible.

 Step 3: Lower your right leg and immediately lift your left knee.

 Step 4: Continue alternating legs, as if running in place while lifting your knees.

Step 1: Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat.

 Step 2: Lean back slightly, keeping your back straight and core engaged.

 Step 3: Clasp your hands together in front of you and twist your torso to the right, then to the left.

 Step 4: Keep your feet off the ground for an added challenge.

Step 1: Lie on your back with your hands behind your head and knees lifted, forming a 90-degree angle.

 Step 2: Bring your right elbow and left knee towards each other while extending your right leg out.

 Step 3: Switch sides by bringing your left elbow and right knee towards each other while extending your left leg out.

 Step 4: Continue alternating sides in a pedaling motion.

Step 1: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor.

 Step 2: Place your hands behind your head, but avoid pulling on your neck.

 Step 3: Curl your upper body off the floor and towards your knees, engaging your abdominal muscles.

 Step 4: Lower your body back down and repeat.

Step 1: Lie on your back with your legs extended and your hands by your sides or under your hips for support.

 Step 2: Lift your legs off the ground while keeping them straight.

 Step 3: Curl your knees towards your chest by lifting your hips off the ground.

 Step 4: Lower your legs back down to the starting position.

Step 1: Begin in a push-up position, but with your weight on your forearms instead of your hands.

 Step 2: Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.

 Step 3: Engage your core and hold this position for the desired duration.

Step 1: Lie on your back with your hands behind your head and knees lifted, forming a 90-degree angle.

 Step 2: Bring your right elbow and left knee towards each other while extending your right leg out.

 Step 3: Switch sides by bringing your left elbow and right knee towards each other while extending your left leg out.

 Step 4: Continue alternating sides in a pedaling motion.

Step 1: Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat.

 Step 2: Lean back slightly, keeping your back straight and core engaged.

 Step 3: Clasp your hands together in front of you and twist your torso to the right, then to the left.

 Step 4: Keep your feet off the ground for an added challenge.

Step 1: Lie on your back with your legs extended and your arms by your sides.

 Step 2: Lift your legs off the ground while keeping them straight.

 Step 3: Slowly lower your legs back down, stopping before they touch the floor.

 Step 4: Lift your legs back up and repeat.

Step 1: Lie on your back with your legs extended and your hands under your hips for support.

 Step 2: Lift your legs off the ground a few inches.

 Step 3: Cross your right leg over your left leg, then switch quickly to cross your left leg over your right.

 Step 4: Continue alternating in a scissor-like motion.

Step 1: Start in a plank position with your hands placed slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.

 Step 2: Lower your body by bending your elbows, keeping your body in a straight line.

 Step 3: Push back up to the starting position.

Step 1: Sit on the edge of a sturdy chair with your hands placed on the edge, fingers pointing forward.

 Step 2: Slide your hips off the chair and walk your feet forward.

 Step 3: Lower your body by bending your elbows, keeping your back close to the chair.

 Step 4: Push through your palms to raise your body back up.

Step 1: Begin in a push-up position with your hands close together, forming a diamond shape with your thumbs and index fingers.

 Step 2: Lower your body by bending your elbows, keeping your elbows close to your sides.

 Step 3: Push back up to the starting position.

Step 1: Place your feet on an elevated surface such as a step or a bench, and assume a push-up position.

 Step 2: Lower your body by bending your elbows, keeping your body in a straight line.

 Step 3: Push back up to the starting position.

Step 1: Start in a push-up position with your hands placed wider than shoulder-width apart.

 Step 2: Lower your body by bending your elbows, keeping your body in a straight line.

 Step 3: Push back up to the starting position.

Step 1: Begin in a push-up position with your hands placed slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.

 Step 2: Lower your body by bending your elbows, and as you push back up, explode off the ground and clap your hands together.

 Step 3: Land with soft elbows and go into the next repetition.

Step 1: Start in a downward dog position, with your hips high and your hands and feet on the ground.

 Step 2: Lower your head toward the ground, bending your elbows and keeping your legs straight.

 Step 3: Push back up to the starting position.

Step 1: Start in a plank position with your arms extended and hands beneath your shoulders.

 Step 2: Lower your body by bending your elbows, keeping your body in a straight line.

 Step 3: Push back up to the starting position.

Step 1: Begin in a plank position with your arms extended and hands beneath your shoulders.

 Step 2: Lift your right arm and extend it forward while simultaneously lifting your left leg and extending it backward.

 Step 3: Hold this position for a moment, then return to the plank position.

 Step 4: Switch sides and repeat the movement.

Step 1: Lie face down on the ground with your arms extended in front of you and your legs straight.

 Step 2: Lift your arms, chest, and legs off the ground as high as possible.

 Step 3: Hold this position for a moment, then lower your limbs back down.

Step 1: Begin in a plank position with your arms extended and hands beneath your shoulders.

 Step 2: Lift your right hand and tap your left shoulder while engaging your core to keep your body stable.

 Step 3: Place your right hand back on the ground and repeat the movement with your left hand tapping your right shoulder.

Step 1: Lie face down on the ground with your arms extended in front of you.

 Step 2: Lift your chest, arms, and legs off the ground as high as possible while squeezing your lower back muscles.

 Step 3: Lower your limbs back down to the ground.

Step 1: Begin on your hands and knees in a tabletop position.

 Step 2: Lift your knees a few inches off the ground, hovering them as you move.

 Step 3: Move your right hand and left foot forward simultaneously, followed by your left hand and right foot.

 Step 4: Keep your hips low and your back straight as you crawl forward.

Step 1: Stand with your feet hip-width apart.

 Step 2: Bend at your waist and place your hands on the ground.

 Step 3: Walk your hands forward until you're in a plank position.

 Step 4: Take small steps with your feet toward your hands, returning to the bent-over position.

 Step 5: Stand up straight and repeat the movement.

Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.

 Step 2: Lower your body by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, as if sitting down on an imaginary chair.

 Step 3: Keep your back straight and your chest up.

 Step 4: Push through your heels to return to the starting position.

Step 1: Start by standing with your feet together.

 Step 2: Take a step forward with one leg and lower your body until both knees are bent at 90-degree angles.

 Step 3: Push off the front foot to return to the starting position.

 Step 4: Repeat with the opposite leg.

Step 1: Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart.

 Step 2: Lower your body into a squat position by bending your knees, keeping your back straight and chest up.

 Step 3: Explosively jump straight up, extending your hips, knees, and ankles simultaneously.

 Step 4: While in the air, bring your knees toward your chest.

 Step 5: Land softly and immediately transition into another squat, repeating the motion for the desired number of reps.

 Step 6: Remember to engage your core muscles throughout the exercise.

Step 1: Stand with your feet hip-width apart.

 Step 2: Lift your heels off the ground as high as possible, standing on your toes.

 Step 3: Lower your heels back down to the ground.

 Step 4: Repeat the movement.

Step 1: Start by standing with your feet together and arms at your sides.

 Step 2: Jump your feet out wide as you simultaneously raise your arms overhead.

 Step 3: Jump your feet back together and return your arms to your sides.

Step 1: Stand with your feet hip-width apart.

 Step 2: Lift your right knee towards your chest, aiming to get it as high as possible.

 Step 3: Lower your right leg and immediately lift your left knee.

 Step 4: Continue alternating legs, as if running in place while lifting your knees.

Step 1: Start by standing with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart and your toes pointed slightly outward.

 Step 2: Keep your chest up and engage your core muscles for stability.

 Step 3: Lower your body by bending your knees and pushing your hips back, as if you're sitting down into a wide squat.

 Step 4: Continue lowering until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as your flexibility allows.

 Step 5: Make sure your knees are tracking over your toes and not caving inward.

 Step 6: Press through your heels to stand back up, straightening your legs.

 Step 7: Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps.

 Step 8: Remember to maintain a neutral spine and avoid hunching your back.
Apples are a good source of dietary fiber, antioxidants, and vitamin C. They support digestive health, help regulate blood sugar, and promote overall well-being.
Bananas are rich in potassium, providing support for heart health and blood pressure regulation. They are also an excellent source of quick energy due to their carbohydrate content.
Berries, such as blueberries, strawberries, and raspberries, are high in antioxidants, vitamins, and fiber. They help reduce oxidative stress, promote heart health, and support digestion.
Oranges are packed with vitamin C, which boosts the immune system and is essential for healthy skin. They also provide fiber and a variety of other vitamins and minerals.
Pineapples are a good source of vitamin C and contain bromelain, an enzyme that aids in digestion. They provide antioxidants and help reduce inflammation.
Grapes contain antioxidants like resveratrol, which may benefit heart health. They also provide vitamins and minerals that support overall well-being.
Watermelon is hydrating due to its high water content and offers vitamins like A and C. It\'s a refreshing fruit choice, especially on hot days.
Mangos are rich in vitamin A and vitamin C, which promote healthy skin and boost the immune system. They also provide fiber and antioxidants for overall well-being.
Salmon is rich in omega-3 fatty acids, promoting heart and brain health, reducing inflammation, and supporting overall well-being.
Tuna is a source of lean protein and omega-3 fatty acids, aiding in muscle health and reducing the risk of chronic diseases.
Tilapia is a low-calorie fish that provides protein and essential nutrients for overall well-being and weight management.
Hilsa fish is a source of protein and healthy fats, supporting muscle health and overall well-being.
Catla fish provides protein and essential nutrients for overall health and well-being.
Rohu Carp offers protein and essential nutrients, supporting muscle health and overall well-being.
Mirror Carp is a source of protein and essential nutrients, contributing to overall health and well-being.
Red Drum fish provides protein and essential nutrients, promoting muscle health and overall well-being.
Lean cuts of beef provide a significant source of protein and essential vitamins like B12 and iron, supporting muscle health and preventing anemia.
Skinless chicken breast is a lean protein source that aids in muscle growth and repair. It is low in saturated fat, making it a heart-healthy choice.
Lean pork cuts provide protein, vitamins, and minerals, contributing to muscle health and overall well-being.
Lamb is a good source of protein, iron, and vitamin B12, which are essential for energy production and maintaining healthy red blood cells.
Veal offers lean protein and essential nutrients, supporting muscle growth and overall health when consumed as part of a balanced diet.
Skinless turkey breast is a lean protein that aids in muscle maintenance and supports heart health by being low in saturated fat.
Duck meat is rich in protein and essential nutrients, although it is higher in fat. When consumed in moderation, it can be part of a healthy diet.
Goat meat provides protein, iron, and vitamins, promoting muscle health and overall well-being.
Almonds are a source of heart-healthy monounsaturated fats, fiber, and essential nutrients, contributing to cardiovascular health and aiding in weight management.
Walnuts offer omega-3 fatty acids, which support brain health and reduce inflammation, along with protein and essential nutrients.
Cashews are a good source of protein and monounsaturated fats, supporting heart health and overall well-being.
Peanuts provide protein, healthy fats, and essential nutrients, making them a nutritious choice for energy and overall health.
Hazelnuts are rich in vitamins and minerals, promoting heart health and overall well-being.
Sunflower seeds are a source of protein, healthy fats, and essential nutrients, contributing to overall health and well-being.
Roasted chestnuts are low in fat and calories, offering carbohydrates and essential nutrients for energy and overall health.
Macadamia nuts are high in monounsaturated fats and essential nutrients, supporting heart health and overall well-being.

Broccoli is a nutritional powerhouse, providing essential vitamins and fiber. It supports the immune system, reduces inflammation, and aids digestion, making it a valuable addition to a balanced diet.
Packed with vitamins and minerals, spinach promotes bone health, aids blood clotting, and boosts the immune system. It is also rich in antioxidants, which help combat chronic diseases.
Carrots are known for their high beta-carotene content, which is beneficial for eye health. They also provide vitamins and fiber, supporting overall well-being.
Tomatoes are a great source of antioxidants like lycopene, which may lower the risk of certain cancers and heart disease. They also offer vitamins and minerals that contribute to a healthy diet.
Cucumbers are low in calories and high in water content, aiding in hydration and weight management. They also provide vitamins and minerals for overall health.

Potatoes offer carbohydrates for energy and essential nutrients like vitamin C and potassium. While they should be consumed in moderation, when prepared healthily, they can be part of a balanced diet.
Asparagus is a low-calorie vegetable rich in vitamins and fiber. It supports digestive health and provides essential nutrients for overall well-being.
Radishes are low in calories and contain vitamin C and other essential nutrients. They promote hydration and are a healthy addition to salads and dishes.
